Replies.Reply: No one can deny the horrendous nature of Mr. Frankenstein's crimes, but in the twenty years he has been with us, I have never seen a patient turn his energies to more productive use.

Just look at his accomplishments... three volumes of poetry, two rock operas, a sculpture garden, four romance novels... and who can forget his touching portrayal of Billy Bigelow in our all-psychotic production of "Carousel"...
Directed by our own Doctor Anabel Leek.
Twenty years ago I was a lost soul. Loveless...

But my deeds have been done, and my youth is gone, and we can only go forward in this cruel world... and if I have learned anything from my wretched life it is that... When you walk through a storm, keep your head held high...
And don't be afraid of the dark...
Those gas leaks can be murder.
I hope you enjoy these cigars.  I had to kill a dozen Cubans to get them.
I knew you'd cone.  I left that skylight open for you.
But did you know I knew you'd know I'd know?
I guess you know just about everything, don't you, Lance?
That I've hot wired the city's entire power supply through that catwalk.
Well, Don, I've done some terrible things in my life, but now I'm cured, and I just want to give back something to my old home town...
The Frankenstein Center for the Arts.
Everything's going exactly as we planned.
It must have slipped my mind.
Don't worry, Pootchkie.  My womanizing days are over.  You're my Lady Macbeth, my Imelda... my Nicole.
We're such an incredible team.  Who could possibly stop us?
Take it easy--take it easy.  I just want to have a little chat... That was quite a number you did on my car.  You've got a lot of violence in you... and I like that in a guy.
You know what the difference is between good and evil, Roy?

Evil is more fun.  When you want something, you just take it, and if somebody gets in your way, you kill them... You seem like a very frustrated guy, Roy.  Unhappy. Unfulfilled. What is it that you've always wanted, always desired?  Because whatever it is, I can give it to you... Fame?

I'll let you in on a little secret, Roy.  In two days this entire city will belong to me, and there's not a damn thing your little pals can do about it.  It's the perfect time to switch teams... So what do you say?
They always call the great ones nuts.
Are you with me... or against me?
Monica... Beautiful name.  It suits you.
I hope you won't take this the wrong way, but I couldn't help but notice... that you're a dead ringer for Veronica Lake in "The Blue Dahlia".
You know I'm writing a play--it's just a little Broadway thing, but thure's a part in it that I think you'd be perfect for.
I'd love to hear you read it. Could you stick around after the luncheon?
What are you three doing here? This is invited guests only.  Out.
Thank you all for coming.  I hope you enjoy the cigars.  I had to kill a dozen Cubans to get them.
Twenty years ago, this town was yours!  AND I WAS YOUR KING!

But they called me a psycho, and they put me away.  For twenty years I rotted in my cell, painting watercolors, writing haikus--just waiting for the day I could take my revenge. Well, brothers, that day has come!
They thought I was crazy? Well the joke's on them--because tonight at precisely midnight--on the twentieth anniversary of my tragic arrest--
Tell you what, Ice.  I'll mke you a friendly little wager.  It I can't do it... you can blow my brains out.  If I can, I'll blow out yours.
Honey, give the boys a taste.

Tonight, at midnight, that sound will be amplified across this entire city.  Murder and mayhem will reign supreme!  And Champion City will be ours again!  This will be our castle! And I will be our king!  And there's no one to stop us!
I thought you'd chickened out on me.
This is where I come to... be alone.
I'll be down in a jiffy.
I saw him walk you home.
Don't be afraid... I never hit a lady...
Fellas, this is woman without whom I would have gone sane.
Thanks, Roy!  She's just my type. You can have her back... when I'm done!
Some girls just know how to die.
Darling, you've got the wrong idea.
I was only strangling her... I've killed hundreds of women. It doesn't mean a thing.
Don't worry, Darling.  I never hit a lady.
Roy... What took you so long?
Let me guess... Bullets don't hurt you.
Smarts, doesn't it?... Shall we dance?
Roy, you're making this too easy.
ON MONICA, still motionless on the bed...
He's just a tyke.  Lighten up.
Hey, why don't we sell him back to his parents? For a million bucks!
And what if he rats on us?
Stick a brick in his Pampers and dump him in the lake.
What are you guys supposed to be...
Really?  Did you mother make those costumes?
This is our territory.  Beat it.
Hey, Boss, we got a stowaway.
So what should we do with him?
Come on, kid, you're goin' for a swim.
Not so fast, gentlemen--and I use the term loosely... Unhand that youngster...
And there's plenty more where that came from.
Wait a minute, Officers. You don't understand--
He doesn't miss a trick, does he?
We take the licks and he gets the chicks.
But look at him... and look at us.
I lost another fork tonight.  She's getting suspicious, I know it.
Because I can't!  Okay?  She wouldn't understand!
We prefer to think of ourselves as unsung... I am the Blue Raja, Master of Silverware...
And these are my associatiates, the Shoveler.
And Mister Furious... His anger is his power.
Usually a superpower is a magical endowment or a great skill.  In his case, it's entirely emotional.
Roy, when was the last time you had an actual date?
Maybe you should try a more romantic approach.
Of course.  I'm such a fool... Thanks, Mummy. Go to bed.
But we don't know for sure it's the same guy.
The most vicious gang of thugs this city ever produced.  Twenty years ago they were Casanova's personal bodyguard.  But after he was busted they crawled into the woodwork.
This looks like a job for Superman--
Oh I'm sorry.  We must have the wrong house.
But there's only three of us, and he's got the entire brotherhood of evil at his disposal.
Yeah, but... who do we know?
He's a legendary masked Mexican crime fighting superwrestler and master of the machete.
No one's sure that he actually exists, but they say he can be contacted by leaving a message on a crumpled up napkin at the Tacky Taco down by the bus station.
But... only when no one is looking.
So you're only invisible... to yourself?
So you're only invisible, when abuolutely no one is looking at you?
Roy, remember, it is all within your power. The only thing that's in your way... is you.
This is it.  Come on in!
I am the Blue Raja, Master of Silverware.
Would you mind filling out these forms; names, addresses, description of superpowers, that sort of thing.
Actually we lied about the babes, but there's plenty of burgers.
And you can't count Horst Buckholtz anyway.
But they all had one thing we haven't got.
A name.  All the great superhero teams have got a fabulous name.
I'm her only son, and she always had such high hopes for me. Medicine.  Law.
The cape.  The turban.  She wouldn't understand.
But in fact... you'd found it.
Are you sure he's still alive?
But, Doc... where's the machine guns?
Twenty years ago all the major hoodlums of this city were united into one great brotherhood of evil, and Casanova was their king.
He busted Casanova and sent the crooks packing.
But how do we get in?
Oh my God... Every crook in the city is here.
The Bone Heads from the South Side...
But that place is huge and we don't know where this psycho thing is--
Mother... it's not what you think!
Oh, Mother, I'm sorry.  I know how much you wanted me to be a doctor or a lawyer with a family--but it's just not who I am!
I use it... to fight evil.
He's turned into a completely normal person!
If this doesn't do it, nothing will!
With or without him, we gotta go!
May the forks be with us!
Not bad for a normal guy!
Wait a minute... That's it.  That's our name. We're... the Mystery Men.
0h, who gives a damn who he is? I can't take this anymore.  Night after night we're on the streets, busting our humps--and for what?
How long do you have to chase a dream before you realize it's not gonna happen?
Leave him alone.  She's his mother, not yours.
So when are we gonna have an on night?
Hey, when are you guys gonna clean this place up?
We may be getting in over our heads here.
And it would be the right thing to do.
I got this cousin.  He's a real doofus, but he claims he can become invisible.
How could I see him if he's invisible?
Hey, why don't you just put a cork in it?
There's just not enough of us.
Yeah, but how do we get to them?
The Bowler?  I remember him from when I was a kid.  He was killed years ago.
Look, honey, being a superhero... it's a guy thing.
But there's still only six of us.
This is your dream... and you can't ever give it up.
He's got the fact that he's Superman!
We didn't think this through very well.
Are you sure he's still lives here?
Crime was rampant.  It wasn't safe to stay in your home.
And this has been a pretty nice place to live ever since.
Maybe it's time we checked that place out.
This place is built like a fortress.
But we gotta find out what's going on in there.
This Kopov, what happened to him?
And we'll take a bunch of 'em with us!
Baby, if I don't make it... find yourself... a normal guy.
Doc, there's got to be a way.
, but he doesn't have a clue how to turn it off.  Suddenly, he hears running feet, turns and sees...
Replies.Didascalie: (with the same image of the eye on it that was on Casanova's computer)

Replies.Reply: This is it!  DO OR DIE!
And that's when the engine blew up.
Well we can't call ourselves the Mystery People.
What a jerk--and like nobody knows who he really is!
He's Lance Hunt!  Just take off the glasses--
A vague similarity?  IT'S THE SAME GUY!
We need a break, that's all! Nobody'd ever heard of him until he busted Casanova Frankenstein!
Why do they always fill stuff these things so full you can't pull 'em out without ripping 'em!
So why don't you just tell her!
We had an off night, that's all.

What does it matter?  Women just want to control you--and talk about their feelings. They want to know why you're angry all the time--and what can they can do to help--so you tell them there's nothing--nothing--just leave me alone--but they bug you and they bug you and they bug you--until you just can't stand it anymore!--so you finally open up--you pop like a blister--and it all comes spewing out--all your emotions--your feelings--your fears--all of it!

Monica stands at the counter placing her order.  Furious approaches her, leans against the counter.  For a moment he just stands there, fuming, unable to think of anything to say. She isn't sure what to make of this.
Doesn't it piss you off the way the when you really want to talk to somebody you can't think of anything to say!
Only when I'm awake... You busy after work?
Want to go out and get drunk?
Like what?  Cutting off my own ear?
Amazing?  What's so amazing about him?  I'd be amazing, too, if I'd inherited two hundred million bucks... or two bucks... or two cents...
Sally, that's a Herkimer Battle Jitney!  They don't make 'em like that anymore.  It's a classic!
I saw him go in--and he didn't come out!
Don't you guys get it?  If Captain Amazing is still in there, we can rescue him--and get on TV!
They share an exasperated look, then scramble over the wall after him.
Are you serious? This is the break we've been waiting for!
What have the famous superheroes got that we don't?
Archenemies!  Casanova isn't just a criminal--
Then maybe it's time for us to form our own brotherhood...
a brotherhood of righteous, crime fighting, skull cracking, Disco Boy bashing, warriors of the night!
I say we send out the word--and summon all of the unsung superheroes we know!
You sure that's how you spell it?
So, let me get this straight.  You have the power to become invisible.
If someone looks at you, you immediately become visible again.
So how do you know that you've ever been invisible?
Look, kid, we've got a lot of heroes to interview--
But we know they're out there. Hundreds--maybe thousands of lonely, unknown superheroes, who desperately need a cause...
Who are we kidding?  No one's gonna show. We're living in a fantasy!
Good or evil, what's the difference?
I used to believe that.  Now I'm not so sure.
If you're a superhero, what's your power?
Hey... Can I buy you a beer?
You know something? Those guys are really starting TO PISS ME OFF!
To hell with a name.  Let's get to work.
What did you do with Captain Amazing?
Anybody up for a little White Castle?
So what else has Superman got?
Okay! We got the firepower!  I say we throw it into the car, drive over to Casanova's house, and kick some ass!
But now Casanova's back!  And we're gonna sit around here all night eating pizza and telling stories! Hey, lets toast some marshmellows!
When are you going to take off that mask?
Go dance with your mother, Jeffrey!
My heart died a long time ago.
Blow it out your bean hole, Pancho!... And to hell with the rest of you!... Look at you. Bunch of rejects.  I didn't need you before--
Monica... I was wondering if--uh-maybe we--I mean you and I--could-uh--you know--get a--I mean have a...
Nothing wrong with being a waitress.
What have they got that we ain't got?
I just want to be a superhero.
And the nuts always call themselves great.
Thanks for reminding me which team I'm on.
Is there room in the pack for one more wolf?
I was wrong... I need my friends.
Casanova said that in two days the entire city would belong to him... and there wasn't a thing that we could do about it.
We just become like the wolf... who wears the sheep's clothing.
We know what we gotta do.
Maybe.  But this isn't about living or dying. It's about good versus evil, and we're good, whether we like it or not... Maybe we look a little funny...
And smell a little funny.  We're not bulletproof and we can't fly. But we're superheroes--and that means doing what's right-
We'll just have to get lucky.
Go do what you gotta do.  We'll meet back here at sunset... Do or die.
Come on, baby... Come on, baby... I SAID COME ON!
Are you nuts?  Get out of there!
He's a psycho!  He'll kill you!
And what if you get killed?
Listen.  He's lonely... and he doesn't care who knows it.
We're all the same really.  Our songs, our dreams, our seeds are all just a brave attempt to live forever.
is perched in the balcony.  It seems to be howling out over the city which is seen in a spectacular view, spread out alonq the lakeshore below.
Replies.Didascalie: (done in the same style as the other sculptures)

Replies.Reply: But I just don't feel it.
Normal.  What's normal?  Does normal exist? And if it did, how would we know it?
You know, Eddie, that was really uncalled for.
Okay, you win.  I'm pissed off. I'm seriously peeved.
This music is just SO BEAUTIFUL!
They hurt... BUT THEY DON'T STOP ME!
It doesn't matter what we call ourselves.  We know who we are.
Crush him, Mikey!... Mash him!... Mush him!
He wants more!... Squish him!... Finish him off!
Police cars and a TV truck come screeching into the train yard... and the scene is suddenly flooded vith light and swarming with cops and reporters...
I know you knew I'd know.
I'd hate to waste a good bullet on a piece of scum like you, Tony.
The jig is up, Casanova.  I've spent six months watching you, and know exactly what you're up to.
I know that you're recruiting your old henchmen...
I know who your girlfriend really is...
And I know the terrible revenge that you plan to inflict on this city.
Isn't my butt cute in these tights?
Oh, my abs are killing me!
Looks like you've done it again, Captain.
Replies.Didascalie: (putty in his hands, pudding in his bowl)

Replies.Reply: ...still no sign of millionaire Lance Hunt, and now, in an unrelated story, another one of Champion City's leading citizens has apparently disappeared. Captain Amazing has not been seen or heard from in a week. Authorities believe that the hard working superhero may just be taking a well deserved rest.

It's been twenty-four hours since the deadly psycho-sonic attack and bloody shoot-out that left Casanova Frankenstein and dozen of the city's top hoodlums dead... But tonight the question remains... Who were these heroic mystery men who saved our city?...
Okay, show's over. Move it. On your way.
Really?  Let me guess-you're Towel Head and he's...
And leave crime fighting to the real thing!
It's my first night.  My name's Monica.
You guys going to a costume party?
So what can I get you?
I guess... Are you always so angry?
Maybe you guys ought to forget this Superhero stuff and join Kiwanis or something.
Why don't you throw a barbecue?
ON OUR HEROES, realizing that's it.
I get off work in fifteen minutes. Walk me home?
ON FURIOUS, feeling a whole lot better.
Being a superhero, wanting to save the world. It's so... unselfish.
Most people just want to make money or be famous or something.  But you risk everything, just to help people.
I've never been able to figure out what to do with my life, which is why I guess I'm still a waitress.
Me too... I love this stupid old town.  It's noisy.  It's smelly. It's falling apart.
I've thought of leaving, going to Chicago or New York, but...
Champion's going to bounce back, and I want to be here when it does.
You don't seem very angry right now.
You know what?  Underneath all that anger I think there's just a little boy who wants everyone to love him.
What are you guys doing here?
What could have made such a horrible noise?
We've got to warn the city.
I just want you guys to know--I may not be a superhero, but I'm with you--and I want to help!
Listen, Casanova may be a supervillain, but he's got a weakness, and I'm it.  Maybe--just maybe--I can trick him into showing me the location of the whatchamathing.
Just shut up and listen.  Hold off the attack as long as you can.  If I can discover the location I'll call you--
Then at least I will have died trying, right?
Roy... We might never see each other again, so I'd better tell you now...  I think you're wonderful.
Could you tell Mr. Frankenstein that Monica is here?
Just wanted to... powder my nose.
I'm not that kind of girl.
I don't want a normal guy.
What are you doing in the silver drawer?
Now honey, you just wait in the car.  Mommy and Daddy will be right beck.
It's nice and cool in here.
Oh my God!  Oh my God!  Oh my God!
And why are you wearing that silly costume?
I always knew that you were special.
Ever since you were a little boy...
Your Great Great Grandmother's wedding silver.
You know, Mr. F, me and the boys always loved workin' for you.  You had such style: the clothes, the dancin', the elegant way you'd snuff a babe.  You were the King...
But times have changed, and you been in that bug house a long tine. I can see you still got the style, but I dunno for sure you still got the edge.
Little old lady.  That's a hundred points!
Hey, in the backseat, who are you supposed to be, the Bowler?
His daughter?  Well guess what, sweetheart? I'm the one who squished your Daddy.  And he squished real good!
And I'm gonna nip it in the bud.
Six losers. Six bullets. Perfect... Got any last words, Angry Boy?
Disco sucks.  Very good.  You know what I'm gonna do, Angry Boy, since you're so colorful? I'm gonna save you for last.
They'll never get through those doors.
We'll take care of these clowns.
Say hello to Daddy for me!
YO! CAPTAIN SOMINEX!  Get your shut-eye at home, or you'll be a full time superhero!
It's all within your power.  The only thing that's in your way is YOU!
How many times I gotta tell you about this?
It's a hunk of junk.  I want the iron.  Do it!
...and continues to deny any knowledge of the incident... In local news, millionaire Lance Hunt has apparently disappeared...

Members at his household told police that the playboy philanthropist failed to return home last night after "going out for a walk". Police say they have no reason yet to suspect foul play, but a search is under way...
...but the Dawn Patrol got this exclusive interview vith two of the suspects.
Not quite.  You haven't announced our engagement yet.
What are you doing all alone in the dark?
If I look at myseif, I become visible.
I know I haven't got it entirely worked out yet, but I've always dreamed of becoming a superhero... Weren't you guys ever a kid? Didn't you ever need someone to just give you a chance?
So what exactly is your superpower?
Come on, guys--we're fighting against evil.
And only one short of the Magnificent Seven.
Dad thinks all this superhero stuff is a stupid waste of time.
I wonder what he dreams about?
Whatever was in that crate... is from Russia.
Guys, I did it! I did it!  I'm invisible!
Boy I can't tell you how thrilled I was when you guys called--You gonna eat that pickle?
I've always dreamed of being a member of the a real superhero team--and to have friends--real friends--I mean guys I could live with--sleep with--die with--eat with...
Well, when I was a kid I grew up on Love Canal-
I tried that once.  The cork melted.
Come on in!  The water's great!
Hey, these pool mints are delicious!
Wait--I got it!... The Spleen Team.

Adolescence was the worst--The other kids made fun of me, so I'd spit on them and they'd scatter--I've never had a girlfriend--unless you count that night with my cousin--She recovered fully though--We exchange cards every Christmas--Well, I send her one, and she sends it back...
Mystery, Mystery Man... I want to be a Mystery Man...
You really are a superhero, aren't you?
Hey, man, is this the superhero wingding?
I am Squeegee Man, and these are my compadres, the Invincible Dudes!

At first glance these guys seem promising... but their outfits are decidedly improvised: weird goggles and sunglasses, shower curtain capes, baseball caps with beer cans on them.  Their leader holds a squeegee with a long handle... Furious is suspicious.
They go immediately to the keg and start filling beer cups and guzzling them down.  The Raja tries to hand out some forms.
ON FURIOUS, watching, starting to get pissed off.
Replies.Didascalie: (but they just toss the forms away)

Replies.Reply: That's false advertising!... We came all the way from South Champion, man!  We coulda gone plinking!... We coulda gone bunqee jumping!
Let's get out of here!... That dude's crazy!
Hey, man, like where are the babes?
It said on the card there'd be babes!
Touch my squeegee... and you die.
No babes--no peace!  No babes--no peace!  No babes--no peace!
If it could zip up its own bag, then you'd be impressed, right?
He was more than just a superhero...  He was my father...

And then one day, he didn't come home.  The police said it was an accident.  But cargo containers don't just fall on people.  He was murdered... After that I fell apart.  I dropped out of school, became a mud wrestler, married and divorced a jerk.  When my mother died I hit bottom... but then, when I was cleaning out her attic, I found my father's old bowling bag and costume, almost like he'd left them there for me... and I knew what I had to do.
That's two more than the Fantastic Four.
But she's your mother.  You gotta tell her.
I know... My girlfriends all dumped me after I put on the mask.  They thought I'd lost it.
Come on, Junior, it's a school night.
My father had this friend... He was an inventor...
He was the last time I saw him.
Doc, these are my friends.  We're superheroes, and we need your help.
Has he always been like this?
They'll think we're just a bunch of weirdoes.
We could really use some coffee--
Or even what it looks like.
Hey, do I look like a Man?
Would you like me to trim the sides?

You call yourselves superheroes? A rooster fights more intelligently than you!  You have shown yourself to your enemy and revealed your powers to him--and what have you accouplished for this?  You have destroyed his car. Brilliant!  If you want to survive you must fight like a wolf pack--not like a six pack!
The wolf is cunning.  He knows that stealth is his greatest weapon, and he always fights as a team...
Not like some drunken Tejano on Saturday night.
Casanova Frankenstein is a a master of evil. You will need more than shovels and dessert forks to stop him... What else have you got?
We are not yet ready.  Now we must learn to fight together... as one thing.
The wise snake coils before he strikes.
When I am sure I am among friends.
Your rage is a very great power, but it blinds you to your heart.
It is not dead.  It is hiding.
He is in love.  His anger is gone.
Elizabeth!  Little Elizabeth!  Why you're so...
Oh that's right--they squished him...  Heck of a guy.
Well, I give to the United Way, and I feel that sort of covers--
My weapons? You need my weapons?
The military establishment has never understood me.  They won't return my phone calls, much less field test anything.  But I knew that someday I'd get my chance, and now... here you are!
You don't need that junk!  You see, for thousands of years mankind has been immolating, disemboweling, and exploding itself.  Why? Because we have this built-in screwed up need to go to war!

So as a young man I thought, why nat have the fun and excitement of war, without all that unnecessary bloodshed.  That's why I have devoted my life to developing an arsenal of highly sophisticated non-lethal military weapons.
Air cannons... Blame throwers... Feet seeking missiles... And perhaps my ultimate invention...

Replies.Didascalie: (Cont'd) (picks up one of the small cans)

Replies.Reply: Ten years ago the Kremlin's top secret Psychiatric Warfare Division developed a prototype for a weapon that emitted a fluctuating alternative frequency noise that produced a violent psychotic reaction in any mammal within hearing distance.  But when the old Soviet Union fell the stridulator and its brilliant inventor, Doctor Kopov, disappeared.
A village in Siberia was wiped out when a cleaning woman switched it on by mistake.
And he must have it well hidden.
Laser eye... and it's a humdinger.
Barkeep, a couple of cold ones.
And here's a banana for your monkey.
Not talking, eh?  That can be fixed.  Turn around, start walking up the hill--
What are you two doing here?
Nobody could drive a whole city crazy.
That was great!... What the hell was that?...
I don't know who those guys were--but I never want to see 'em again.
Especially that big dude with the shovel...
A Herkimer?  Those yuppies will drive anything.
Help!... Get me out of this!
Dad!... Dad!... You okay?... You hurt?
So you're never actually conscious of range or trajectory?
